node.text:
Thanks to our fantastic sponsor: @matific I am sharing essential tips for teachers to prepare for the school year! Feel free to share or ask questions and add your own tips in the comments section. For more tips, be sure to check out my new blog post in which I share additional information and ideas that will help us all start the year calm and ready to go! ~ Jen
.
.
.
 #edtech #matificb2s

node.title: Back to school tips for teachers!

node.text: I’ve been asked to show the photo books I made for the kids. These have been given as gifts somewhere along the way, usually when a new sibling was about to be welcomed into the family. I hope I’ve given enough detail, but please message if you have more questions.

node.text:
We just want to help❤️ With the situation in Sydney and beyond, with remote learning a reality, the best thing I can do to celebrate 300k followers is this. It’s such a fantastic offer that will help so many.🥰 Thank you Twinkl! 

For all my followers who do not already have a @twinklaustralia account you can get one month access to a core level account at zero cost! 🙌 I’ll add the link to my bio for a few days to help you access it.😘 Feel free to tag your friends or share so that word gets around. 

While you’re here, share your best remote learning tips for parents and teachers. I’m definitely always willing to learn new ideas and I’m pretty sure most people don’t mind a bit of help.❤️~ Jen @living_future_memories @where_heart_meets_home

node.text:
Flowers frozen in time😍❄️ Otherwise known as Elsa’s flowers.💁‍♀️😉 But to me, they remind me of the “Tangled” movie.🤷‍♀️ Regardless, they are beautiful and the ice acts like a magnifying glass. This is a great provocation for senses & our environment! 💕❄️ Who will be freezing flowers sometime soon?! 
.
.
.

node.text:
Video classroom tour & a few pics 🎥📸🌈 This is a little look at my classroom last term (there was so much I didn’t have time to share, so why not do so now?!!😊) Feel free to share or ask questions.❤️ 
.
.
Back story: I’m sad I won’t have my little Koalas in my classroom Monday morning next week & as the Dean of Junior Primary at our school I hope all our families are safe & transition to OCL (Off Campus Learning) well. Everyone is perfectly ready to go and all the teachers & parents are amazing, so I know it will probably be completely fine. But I wish I could do something more somehow. I don’t like that nothing-more-I-can-do feeling! 
.
.
For those of you interested in the school side of my account, make sure you have a look at @invite_to_learn and @st_petersanglican (which will be transitioning to the new name: ‘St Peter’s Anglican Grammar’ next year as we extend into secondary school 🤩) - I post for both of these accounts too. If you are in school leadership, consider following my boss @stpetersheadmaster - a wonderful headmaster who definitely knows what he’s doing. I always love the DMs asking how I ‘get away with’ teaching the way I do.😂 His account may provide answers. 
.
.
My home accounts are @living_future_memories for the ‘real’ of my family & I (especially in stories) and @where_heart_meets_home for the pretty side of our home life. 
.
.
Meanwhile, I’ll add to stories some of our learning options for Libby I’ve made available for her today so I can get work done & my older children can do their schoolwork. Are you finding these stories helpful? What are you all up to today? 💕 Jen x

node.text:
Rainbow rain cloud 🌈🌧🌟

I’ve done this activity countless times! But no great videos.🤷‍♀️ And I’m in lockdown with a whole bunch of kids and working full time. Sooooo I’ve borrowed video from the amazing @bestideasforkids and made it into a reel for fun!! Because I NEED a bit of fun and love sharing great ideas with you all.❤️ For the full video, check out the above mentioned account.😊 Have a go at this activity (I prefer it outdoors on a sunny day). Pour the contents once done into a plastic container with some large scoops/spoons, cups and bowls, and let the kids play!!!!!! ~Jen @living_future_memories @where_heart_meets_home

node.text: Preschooler home set up 🌈🌟 Not my normal way to do things at home, but necessary for the situation we are in: 4 children remote learning & I am working from home (lockdown area). I have therefore replicated what Libby does at Prep (mixed with what we normally do at home). She attends Prep in another class where I work @st_petersanglican ❤️ I will be sharing ideas again on @invite_to_learn (the school early learning account) to support our lovely students (helping their parents) who are still on holidays, but are in lockdown. Feel free to join me there. The in-use home photos can be found in stories over on @living_future_memories as always. Shares/questions welcome. Jen😘

node.text:
Stovetop clay is AMAZING!!!!! Can I say it again???!! AMAZING! Best clay ever.🙌 Also a good (very smooth) everyday dough too.👌
.
.
How to:
❤️Combine: 1/2 cup corn flour (starch), 1 cup baking soda (bicarbonate soda), and 3/4 cup water in a fly pan.
🧡Mix together, constantly stirring after turning stove top on to a medium heat.
💛Once the dough forms place it in a container to cook.
💚Roll out and form any shape you wish!
💙Place in the oven for 1 hour at 95 degrees Celsius. Flip the items, then cook at the same temperature for another hour.
💜Leave to cool, then paint and decorate as you wish!
.
.
The dough is very smooth, and if left overnight (which we did as I made it while I was standing at the stove cooking dinner) just work in in your hands for a few minutes before rolling out. Left overnight it feels like fondant at first, where as it feels like cloud dough when it’s just been made. This is by far the best clay I’ve used- cost effective and it seems like it will be a more durable result than other types I’ve used. I can’t wait to experiment a bit more!! Who is willing to give this a go?! Jen @living_future_memories @where_heart_meets_home @where_family_meets_adventure 

{Thank you to @livethescottcottage for the recipe ❤️}

node.text:
My beautiful classroom for my beloved Koalas 🐨🥰 (Skip to the end for activity list.😘)

I post this, the last day of last term for my class, a little sad tonight. Tomorrow I should be preparing to go back for the term, however we are currently in lockdown. Instead I prepare to homeschool 4 of my own children, look after my 4 yr old, and work from home. We will make it work, I’m sure. It’s just that I actually love my job. I love being at work. My kids love being at school. We are all, really, just a little heart broken: for ourselves, for each other, and for others we know. I personally thought immediately of the parents at my school. I remember standing at assembly, reading out the names of the Junior Primary Term Award recipients, thinking how awesome it was to have so many parents in our school. I’d felt the same at Mother’s Day breakfast & other recent events. It felt like a community again- like a school should feel. And now, it feels like a huge step backwards. I think of the stress on the families and especially the little ones who see it all, and want so badly to help, but feel powerless. I understand how they feel. I too want to make things better, but am not sure how to. So, I post here. I do what I can with what I have in my hands, hoping that someone out there has a better day because of something I’ve written or photographed. I wish I could solve all the problems! But for now this will have to do. Know I am praying for us all through the messiness of life. You matter so much to the little ones in your care- never forget that.❤️ Jen xx
.
.
Activities:
❤️Underground provocation. We had our learning journal on top where students drew & I recorded their thinking
🧡Letter sound exploration in chickpeas
💛Mirror hex tray @modernteaching with elastic bands & loose parts (transient art)
💚Number trays @stayclassyclassrooms numbers & loose parts
💙Collage
💜Pom poms with egg cartons & number stickers in them
🖤Chalkboards with letter rocks, water, brushes & chalk (new @modernteaching chalk boards!)
🤍Fairytale building set @the_freckled_frog (not shown)
🤎Building table with various materials @thecreativetoyshop 
💗Numbers & loose parts on the light table.

Line art 🖼 Crayon + watercolour paint = 🌈😍
.
.
Fun for children (and adults😉) of all ages! Questions/sharing welcome.😘Who will have a go of this activity?? ~ Jen 
.
.

node.text:
No cook play dough!!! This is my hand made recipe. I do have a thermomix recipe which is different, but I have no video, so it will come later. And note: the videos were created a year ago so contain regular glitter. Back then I didn’t know eco glitter existed! Now I use @theglittertribe glitter and recommend it. As always, I’ll say that although I make play dough for work, my own children are play dough snobs and prefer @wilddough.co (just keeping it authentic guys). I don’t bother making play dough for them, as it’s a great gift for a child of a large family. Shares/questions are fine.😘 Jen @living_future_memories @where_heart_meets_home @where_family_meets_adventure 
.
.
How to:
❤️Add to bowl:
*2C flour (packed in level cups, or heaped in cup if loose) +extra if needed at the end if it’s too wet
*2tbsp cream of tartar
*1/2C salt
*3-4tbsp oil 
*food colouring & essential oils (both optional)
🧡Add 1 1/2C just boiled water.
💛Mix & turn out to cool on baking paper.
💚Add extra flour if needed until consistency is how you like it. This is they key to getting it just right.
💙Store in container. Make sure children have clean hand before using to keep it at it’s best.
.
.

node.text:
Mystery dough🌈✨Here it (finally) is!!! I’ve been promising the ‘how to’ for soooo long! Thank you for your patience. Note: you should absolutely do this at least once, even if it’s with just one colour. It’s so much fun!! AND it’s fantastic for developing strength in hands that will one day do super important jobs (think about how important hands are in some of the critical vocations around the world!)
.
.
How to:
❤️Make regular white play dough. I made two batches.
🧡Divide into similar sized pieces.
💛Make holes in the dough pieces.
💚Add food colouring (about 2-5mls).
💙Carefully close up the hole on top.
💜Let the child make guesses before they discover the colour for themselves!!!! Enjoy watching- resist the urge to take over and mix in the colour. The child may need a few attempts over a couple of days to mix the colour in, but will feel the ‘success’ feeling once it’s done.
🤎Store in a container.
.
.
Now, who is going to give this a go?!! 😘Jen @living_future_memories @where_heart_meets_home
